title: Quality and Safety Expert Training Program for Medication Management in Residential Facilities for People with Disabilities

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of basic medical terminology, introduction to pharmacology, and disability awareness education
context.additional_context: Specialized job-linked course for healthcare communication majors in graduate linguistics programs. Field-intensive curriculum design centered on real-world medication management cases in disability facilities

learning_goals: Students can explain three or more medication management quality standards required in residential facilities for people with disabilities and provide implementation examples
Students can reproduce a five-step safety protocol for medication error prevention through role-play simulations
Students can create customized medication administration guides for patients with communication disorders through team-based projects
Students can propose standardized documentation guidelines for multidisciplinary team collaboration in medication management
Students can implement a digital medication side-effect monitoring system using tools such as apps or spreadsheets

resources: Field visit agreement for facilities for people with disabilities

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
